chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean Patrick Bledsoe

records.addlTxt: No reply from surety/defendant.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500) gj

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 65 days in the House of Correction, with 65 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Sentence to run concurrent with count 2.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges by 11/30/18, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 65 days in the House of Correction, with 65 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Sentence to fun concurrent with count 1.
The court ordered defendant to pay the costs by 11/30/18; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. The court found that the defendant is indigent and imposed the DNA sample and the DV evaluation but waived the surcharges for them.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered the domestice abuse repeater penalty enhancers as to counts 1 & 2, as well as the habitual criminality penalty enhancer as to count 2 DISMISSED.  Defendant prepared to enter a change of plea.  
AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Case proceeded to sentencing.

Defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe not in court, defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Mcmurray not in court. Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for final pretrial. State provided an update on the record regarding contact with defense counsel. Court will leave Jury Trial calendared for 5-30-18 at 8:30 am, Branch 36.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000 and no Electronic Monitoring.  All terms and conditions previously ordered as to bail to remain in effect.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Speedy trial demand (expiration 7/9/18).

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe not in court, in custody.  Student Intern Stacia Dunn under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for Porchia Lewand for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 3, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.
Return on warrant on April 10, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Sheriff's Department on 4/3/18. Case is scheduled for April 10, 2018 at 1:30 pm for return on warrant/bail hearing in branch 36. Notice is sent to state and defense. Office of the State Public Defender contacted for appointment of counsel.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report: Missed Office Contact. Violation previously addressed. Case remains in Bench Warrant Status.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray NOT in court, advised via voicemail.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT in court. Case before the court to address the Justice Point Violation Report; Missed Office Contact & Telephone Contact. FILE NOT IN COURT. Defendant failing to comply with conditions of bail, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense. Court VACTED the Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Telephone Contact.

Defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Nicholas Rice-MPD Officer.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF2926 and #14CM1816 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.

Defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT. COUNT 1:KNOWINGLY VIOLATE A DOMESTIC ABUSE INJUNCTION, DOMESTIC ABUSE REPEATER, REPEATER, DOMESTIC ABUSE ASSESSMENTS contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 813.12(4) and (8)(a), 939.621(1)(b) and 2, 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(b), a Misdemeanor.  COUNT 2:DISORDERLY CONDUCT, DOMESTIC ABUSE REPEATER, REPEATER, DOMESTIC ABUSE ASSESSMENTS contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(b) a Class B Misdemeanor.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case spun to Preliminary Court.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM023092  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/02/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Sharon B or her residence; Maurice G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Sean Patrick Bledsoe in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
